solution_line_template: At a rate of {poodle_groom_time_per_poodle} minutes per poodle, {num_poodles} poodles will take {num_poodles}*{poodle_groom_time_per_poodle}=<<{num_poodles}*{poodle_groom_time_per_poodle}={total_poodle_groom_time}>>{total_poodle_groom_time} minutes.

If it takes half as much time to groom a terrier as it takes to groom a poodle, it takes {poodle_groom_time_per_poodle}/{half_divisor}=<<{poodle_groom_time_per_poodle}/{half_divisor}={terrier_groom_time_per_terrier}>>{terrier_groom_time_per_terrier} minutes per terrier.
At a rate of {terrier_groom_time_per_terrier} minutes per terrier, {num_terriers} terriers will take {total_terrier_groom_time} minutes.

Thus, in total, it will take the pet shop {total_poodle_groom_time}+{total_terrier_groom_time}=<<{total_poodle_groom_time}+{total_terrier_groom_time}={total_grooming_time}>>{total_grooming_time} minutes to groom 3 poodles and 8 terriers.
